intro: Henningia stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf henningia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically narrow and lance-shaped. Its flowers are clustered in inflorescences and are usually white or pale yellow, with four petals. Henningia stenophylla is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
